definitions.definition: A constituent segment within a text, such as a word or a phrase that forms a syntactic unit.
examples: The syntagma “the God of peace” (in Greek ὁ Θεὸς τῆς εἰρήνης ) occurs in all undisputed Pauline letters.

definitions.definition: An arrangement of units that together bears a meaning .
examples: To combine a sequence of shots into a larger syntagma , there has to be a connection between the successive shots.

definitions.definition: A Macedonian phalanx fighting formation consisting of 256 men with long spears ( sarissae ).
examples: The men forming the syntagma were arranged in a square of sixteen files of sixteen.

definitions.definition: An organized structural , functional unit of anatomical or chemical subunits : equivalent to " tagma ", or a structure comprising several tagmata in various contexts .
